 321:         """
 322:         For every item the cosine similarity against other items depends on whether they have users in common. The more
 323:         common users the higher the similarity.
 324:         
 325:         The basic implementation is:
 326:         - Select the first item
 327:         - Loop through all other items
 328:         -- Given the two items, get the users they have in common
 329:         -- Update the similarity for all common users
 330:         
 331:         That is VERY slow due to the common user part, in which a long data structure is looped multiple times.
 332:         
 333:         A better way is to use the data structure in a different way skipping the search part, getting directly the
 334:         information we need.
 335:         
 336:         The implementation here used is:
 337:         - Select the first item
 338:         - Initialize a zero valued array for the similarities
